trans-unit.source: Manage your first API in Azure API Management | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage your first API in Azure API Management | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create APIs, add operations, and get started with API Management.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create APIs, add operations, and get started with API Management.

trans-unit.source: Manage your first API in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: Manage your first API in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to quickly get started in using Azure API Management and make your first API call.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to quickly get started in using Azure API Management and make your first API call.

trans-unit.source: What is Azure API Management?
trans-unit.target: What is Azure API Management?

trans-unit.source: You can use Azure API Management to take any backend and launch a full-fledged API program based on it.
trans-unit.target: You can use Azure API Management to take any backend and launch a full-fledged API program based on it.

trans-unit.source: Common scenarios include:
trans-unit.target: Common scenarios include:

trans-unit.source: **Securing mobile infrastructure** by gating access with API keys, preventing DOS attacks by using throttling, or using advanced security policies like JWT token validation.
trans-unit.target: **Securing mobile infrastructure** by gating access with API keys, preventing DOS attacks by using throttling, or using advanced security policies like JWT token validation.

trans-unit.source: **Enabling ISV partner ecosystems** by offering fast partner onboarding through the developer portal and building an API facade to decouple from internal implementations that are not ripe for partner consumption.
trans-unit.target: **Enabling ISV partner ecosystems** by offering fast partner onboarding through the developer portal and building an API facade to decouple from internal implementations that are not ripe for partner consumption.

trans-unit.source: **Running an internal API program** by offering a centralized location for the organization to communicate about the availability and latest changes to APIs, gating access based on organizational accounts, all based on a secured channel between the API gateway and the backend.
trans-unit.target: **Running an internal API program** by offering a centralized location for the organization to communicate about the availability and latest changes to APIs, gating access based on organizational accounts, all based on a secured channel between the API gateway and the backend.

trans-unit.source: The system is made up of the following components:
trans-unit.target: The system is made up of the following components:

trans-unit.source: The **API gateway** is the endpoint that:
trans-unit.target: The **API gateway** is the endpoint that:

trans-unit.source: Accepts API calls and routes them to your backends.
trans-unit.target: Accepts API calls and routes them to your backends.

trans-unit.source: Verifies API keys, JWT tokens, certificates, and other credentials.
trans-unit.target: Verifies API keys, JWT tokens, certificates, and other credentials.

trans-unit.source: Enforces usage quotas and rate limits.
trans-unit.target: Enforces usage quotas and rate limits.

trans-unit.source: Transforms your API on the fly without code modifications.
trans-unit.target: Transforms your API on the fly without code modifications.

trans-unit.source: Caches backend responses where set up.
trans-unit.target: Caches backend responses where set up.

trans-unit.source: Logs call metadata for analytics purposes.
trans-unit.target: Logs call metadata for analytics purposes.

trans-unit.source: The **publisher portal** is the administrative interface where you set up your API program.
trans-unit.target: The **publisher portal** is the administrative interface where you set up your API program.

trans-unit.source: Use it to:
trans-unit.target: Use it to:

trans-unit.source: Define or import API schema.
trans-unit.target: Define or import API schema.

trans-unit.source: Package APIs into products.
trans-unit.target: Package APIs into products.

trans-unit.source: Set up policies like quotas or transformations on the APIs.
trans-unit.target: Set up policies like quotas or transformations on the APIs.

trans-unit.source: Get insights from analytics.
trans-unit.target: Get insights from analytics.

trans-unit.source: Manage users.
trans-unit.target: Manage users.

trans-unit.source: The **developer portal** serves as the main web presence for developers, where they can:
trans-unit.target: The **developer portal** serves as the main web presence for developers, where they can:

trans-unit.source: Read API documentation.
trans-unit.target: Read API documentation.

trans-unit.source: Try out an API via the interactive console.
trans-unit.target: Try out an API via the interactive console.

trans-unit.source: Create an account and subscribe to get API keys.
trans-unit.target: Create an account and subscribe to get API keys.

trans-unit.source: Access analytics on their own usage.
trans-unit.target: Access analytics on their own usage.

trans-unit.source: Create an API Management instance
trans-unit.target: Create an API Management instance

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial][].
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial][].

trans-unit.source: The first step in working with API Management is to create a service instance.
trans-unit.target: The first step in working with API Management is to create a service instance.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Classic Portal][] and click **New**, **App Services**, **API Management**, **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Classic Portal][] and click **New**, **App Services**, **API Management**, **Create**.

trans-unit.source: ![API Management new instance][api-management-create-instance-menu]
trans-unit.target: ![API Management new instance][api-management-create-instance-menu]

trans-unit.source: For **URL**, specify a unique sub-domain name to use for the service URL.
trans-unit.target: For **URL**, specify a unique sub-domain name to use for the service URL.

trans-unit.source: Choose the desired **Subscription** and **Region** for your service instance.
trans-unit.target: Choose the desired **Subscription** and **Region** for your service instance.

trans-unit.source: After making your selections, click the **Next** button.
trans-unit.target: After making your selections, click the **Next** button.

trans-unit.source: ![New API Management service][api-management-create-instance-step1]
trans-unit.target: ![New API Management service][api-management-create-instance-step1]

trans-unit.source: Enter **Contoso Ltd.** for the **Organization Name**, and enter your email address in the **Administrator E-Mail** field.
trans-unit.target: Enter **Contoso Ltd.** for the **Organization Name**, and enter your email address in the **Administrator E-Mail** field.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This email address is used for notifications from the API Management system.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This email address is used for notifications from the API Management system.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to configure notifications and email templates in Azure API Management][].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to configure notifications and email templates in Azure API Management][].

trans-unit.source: ![New API Management service][api-management-create-instance-step2]
trans-unit.target: ![New API Management service][api-management-create-instance-step2]

trans-unit.source: API Management service instances are available in three tiers: Developer, Standard, and Premium.
trans-unit.target: API Management service instances are available in three tiers: Developer, Standard, and Premium.

trans-unit.source: By default, new API Management service instances are created in the Developer tier.
trans-unit.target: By default, new API Management service instances are created in the Developer tier.

trans-unit.source: To select the Standard or Premium tier, check the **Advanced settings** check box and select the desired tier on the following screen.
trans-unit.target: To select the Standard or Premium tier, check the **Advanced settings** check box and select the desired tier on the following screen.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Developer Tier is for development, testing, and pilot API programs where high availability is not a concern.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Developer Tier is for development, testing, and pilot API programs where high availability is not a concern.

trans-unit.source: In the Standard and Premium tiers, you can scale your reserved unit count to handle more traffic.
trans-unit.target: In the Standard and Premium tiers, you can scale your reserved unit count to handle more traffic.

trans-unit.source: The Standard and Premium tiers provide your API Management service with the most processing power and performance.
trans-unit.target: The Standard and Premium tiers provide your API Management service with the most processing power and performance.

trans-unit.source: You can complete this tutorial by using any tier.
trans-unit.target: You can complete this tutorial by using any tier.

trans-unit.source: For more information about API Management tiers, see [API Management pricing][].
trans-unit.target: For more information about API Management tiers, see [API Management pricing][].

trans-unit.source: Click the check box to create your service instance.
trans-unit.target: Click the check box to create your service instance.

trans-unit.source: ![New API Management service][api-management-instance-created]
trans-unit.target: ![New API Management service][api-management-instance-created]

trans-unit.source: Once the service instance is created, the next step is to create or import an API.
trans-unit.target: Once the service instance is created, the next step is to create or import an API.

trans-unit.source: Import an API
trans-unit.target: Import an API

trans-unit.source: An API consists of a set of operations that can be invoked from a client application.
trans-unit.target: An API consists of a set of operations that can be invoked from a client application.

trans-unit.source: API operations are proxied to existing web services.
trans-unit.target: API operations are proxied to existing web services.

trans-unit.source: APIs can be created (and operations can be added) manually, or they can be imported.
trans-unit.target: APIs can be created (and operations can be added) manually, or they can be imported.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we will import the API for a sample calculator web service provided by Microsoft and hosted on Azure.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we will import the API for a sample calculator web service provided by Microsoft and hosted on Azure.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For guidance on creating an API and manually adding operations, see [How to create APIs](api-management-howto-create-apis.md) and [How to add operations to an API](api-management-howto-add-operations.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For guidance on creating an API and manually adding operations, see [How to create APIs](api-management-howto-create-apis.md) and [How to add operations to an API](api-management-howto-add-operations.md).

trans-unit.source: APIs are configured from the publisher portal, which is accessed through the Azure Classic Portal.
trans-unit.target: APIs are configured from the publisher portal, which is accessed through the Azure Classic Portal.

trans-unit.source: To reach the publisher portal, click **Manage** in the Azure Classic Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To reach the publisher portal, click **Manage** in the Azure Classic Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: ![Publisher portal][api-management-management-console]
trans-unit.target: ![Publisher portal][api-management-management-console]

trans-unit.source: To import the calculator API, click **APIs** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and then click **Import API**.
trans-unit.target: To import the calculator API, click **APIs** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and then click **Import API**.

trans-unit.source: ![Import API button][api-management-import-api]
trans-unit.target: ![Import API button][api-management-import-api]

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to configure the calculator API:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to configure the calculator API:

trans-unit.source: Click **From URL**, enter **http://calcapi.cloudapp.net/calcapi.json** into the **Specification document URL** text box, and click the **Swagger** radio button.
trans-unit.target: Click **From URL**, enter **http://calcapi.cloudapp.net/calcapi.json** into the **Specification document URL** text box, and click the **Swagger** radio button.

trans-unit.source: Type **calc** into the **Web API URL suffix** text box.
trans-unit.target: Type **calc** into the **Web API URL suffix** text box.

trans-unit.source: Click in the **Products (optional)** box and choose **Starter**.
trans-unit.target: Click in the **Products (optional)** box and choose **Starter**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to import the API.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to import the API.

trans-unit.source: ![Add new API][api-management-import-new-api]
trans-unit.target: ![Add new API][api-management-import-new-api]

trans-unit.source: Once the API is imported, the summary page for the API is displayed in the publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: Once the API is imported, the summary page for the API is displayed in the publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: ![API summary][api-management-imported-api-summary]
trans-unit.target: ![API summary][api-management-imported-api-summary]

trans-unit.source: The API section has several tabs.
trans-unit.target: The API section has several tabs.

trans-unit.source: The **Summary** tab displays basic metrics and information about the API.
trans-unit.target: The **Summary** tab displays basic metrics and information about the API.

trans-unit.source: The [Settings](api-management-howto-create-apis.md#configure-api-settings) tab is used to view and edit the configuration for an API.
trans-unit.target: The [Settings](api-management-howto-create-apis.md#configure-api-settings) tab is used to view and edit the configuration for an API.

trans-unit.source: The [Operations](api-management-howto-add-operations.md) tab is used to manage the API's operations.
trans-unit.target: The [Operations](api-management-howto-add-operations.md) tab is used to manage the API's operations.

trans-unit.source: The **Security** tab can be used to configure gateway authentication for the backend server by using Basic authentication or [mutual certificate authentication](api-management-howto-mutual-certificates.md), and to configure [user authorization by using OAuth 2.0](api-management-howto-oauth2.md).
trans-unit.target: The **Security** tab can be used to configure gateway authentication for the backend server by using Basic authentication or [mutual certificate authentication](api-management-howto-mutual-certificates.md), and to configure [user authorization by using OAuth 2.0](api-management-howto-oauth2.md).

trans-unit.source: The **Issues** tab is used to view issues reported by the developers who are using your APIs.
trans-unit.target: The **Issues** tab is used to view issues reported by the developers who are using your APIs.

trans-unit.source: The **Products** tab is used to configure the products that contain this API.
trans-unit.target: The **Products** tab is used to configure the products that contain this API.

trans-unit.source: By default, each API Management instance comes with two sample products:
trans-unit.target: By default, each API Management instance comes with two sample products:

trans-unit.source: **Starter**
trans-unit.target: **Starter**

trans-unit.source: **Unlimited**
trans-unit.target: **Unlimited**

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, the Basic Calculator API was added to the Starter product when the API was imported.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, the Basic Calculator API was added to the Starter product when the API was imported.

trans-unit.source: In order to make calls to an API, developers must first subscribe to a product that gives them access to it.
trans-unit.target: In order to make calls to an API, developers must first subscribe to a product that gives them access to it.

trans-unit.source: Developers can subscribe to products in the developer portal, or administrators can subscribe developers to products in the publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: Developers can subscribe to products in the developer portal, or administrators can subscribe developers to products in the publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: You are an administrator since you created the API Management instance in the previous steps in the tutorial, so you are already subscribed to every product by default.
trans-unit.target: You are an administrator since you created the API Management instance in the previous steps in the tutorial, so you are already subscribed to every product by default.

trans-unit.source: Call an operation from the developer portal
trans-unit.target: Call an operation from the developer portal

trans-unit.source: Operations can be called directly from the developer portal, which provides a convenient way to view and test the operations of an API.
trans-unit.target: Operations can be called directly from the developer portal, which provides a convenient way to view and test the operations of an API.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial step, you will call the Basic Calculator API's **Add two integers** operation.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial step, you will call the Basic Calculator API's **Add two integers** operation.

trans-unit.source: Click **Developer portal** from the menu at the top right of the publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: Click **Developer portal** from the menu at the top right of the publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: ![Developer portal][api-management-developer-portal-menu]
trans-unit.target: ![Developer portal][api-management-developer-portal-menu]

trans-unit.source: Click **APIs** from the top menu, and then click **Basic Calculator** to see the available operations.
trans-unit.target: Click **APIs** from the top menu, and then click **Basic Calculator** to see the available operations.

trans-unit.source: ![Developer portal][api-management-developer-portal-calc-api]
trans-unit.target: ![Developer portal][api-management-developer-portal-calc-api]

trans-unit.source: Note the sample descriptions and parameters that were imported along with the API and operations, providing documentation for the developers that will use this operation.
trans-unit.target: Note the sample descriptions and parameters that were imported along with the API and operations, providing documentation for the developers that will use this operation.

trans-unit.source: These descriptions can also be added when operations are added manually.
trans-unit.target: These descriptions can also be added when operations are added manually.

trans-unit.source: To call the **Add two integers** operation, click **Try it**.
trans-unit.target: To call the **Add two integers** operation, click **Try it**.

trans-unit.source: ![Try it][api-management-developer-portal-calc-api-console]
trans-unit.target: ![Try it][api-management-developer-portal-calc-api-console]

trans-unit.source: You can enter some values for the parameters or keep the defaults, and then click **Send**.
trans-unit.target: You can enter some values for the parameters or keep the defaults, and then click **Send**.

trans-unit.source: ![HTTP Get][api-management-invoke-get]
trans-unit.target: ![HTTP Get][api-management-invoke-get]

trans-unit.source: After an operation is invoked, the developer portal displays the **Response status**, the **Response headers**, and any **Response content**.
trans-unit.target: After an operation is invoked, the developer portal displays the **Response status**, the **Response headers**, and any **Response content**.

trans-unit.source: ![Response][api-management-invoke-get-response]
trans-unit.target: ![Response][api-management-invoke-get-response]

trans-unit.source: View analytics
trans-unit.target: View analytics

trans-unit.source: To view analytics for Basic Calculator, switch back to the publisher portal by selecting **Manage** from the menu at the top right of the developer portal.
trans-unit.target: To view analytics for Basic Calculator, switch back to the publisher portal by selecting **Manage** from the menu at the top right of the developer portal.

trans-unit.source: ![Manage][api-management-manage-menu]
trans-unit.target: ![Manage][api-management-manage-menu]

trans-unit.source: The default view for the publisher portal is the **Dashboard**, which provides an overview of your API Management instance.
trans-unit.target: The default view for the publisher portal is the **Dashboard**, which provides an overview of your API Management instance.

trans-unit.source: ![Dashboard][api-management-dashboard]
trans-unit.target: ![Dashboard][api-management-dashboard]

trans-unit.source: Hover the mouse over the chart for **Basic Calculator** to see the specific metrics for the usage of the API for a given time period.
trans-unit.target: Hover the mouse over the chart for **Basic Calculator** to see the specific metrics for the usage of the API for a given time period.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you don't see any lines on your chart, switch back to the developer portal and make some calls into the API, wait a few moments, and then come back to the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you don't see any lines on your chart, switch back to the developer portal and make some calls into the API, wait a few moments, and then come back to the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Click **View Details** to view the summary page for the API, including a larger version of the displayed metrics.
trans-unit.target: Click **View Details** to view the summary page for the API, including a larger version of the displayed metrics.

trans-unit.source: ![Analytics][api-management-mouse-over]
trans-unit.target: ![Analytics][api-management-mouse-over]

trans-unit.source: ![Summary][api-management-api-summary-metrics]
trans-unit.target: ![Summary][api-management-api-summary-metrics]

trans-unit.source: For detailed metrics and reports, click **Analytics** from the **API Management** menu on the left.
trans-unit.target: For detailed metrics and reports, click **Analytics** from the **API Management** menu on the left.

trans-unit.source: ![Overview][api-management-analytics-overview]
trans-unit.target: ![Overview][api-management-analytics-overview]

trans-unit.source: The **Analytics** section has the following four tabs:
trans-unit.target: The **Analytics** section has the following four tabs:

trans-unit.source: **At a glance** provides overall usage and health metrics, as well as the top developers, top products, top APIs, and top operations.
trans-unit.target: **At a glance** provides overall usage and health metrics, as well as the top developers, top products, top APIs, and top operations.

trans-unit.source: **Usage** provides an in-depth look at API calls and bandwidth, including a geographical representation.
trans-unit.target: **Usage** provides an in-depth look at API calls and bandwidth, including a geographical representation.

trans-unit.source: **Health** focuses on status codes, cache success rates, response times, and API and service response times.
trans-unit.target: **Health** focuses on status codes, cache success rates, response times, and API and service response times.

trans-unit.source: **Activity** provides reports that drill down on the specific activity by developer, product, API, and operation.
trans-unit.target: **Activity** provides reports that drill down on the specific activity by developer, product, API, and operation.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Check out the other topics in the [Get started with advanced API configuration][] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Check out the other topics in the [Get started with advanced API configuration][] tutorial.
